steps.Step 3: While the pasta is cooking, in a separate pot, melt the butter. Whisk in the flour and mustard and keep it moving for about five minutes. Make sure it's free of lumps. Stir in the milk, onion, bay leaf, and paprika. Simmer for ten minutes and remove the bay leaf.
steps.Step 4: Temper in the egg. Stir in 3/4 of the cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Fold the macaroni into the mix and pour into a 2-quart casserole dish. Top with remaining cheese.
steps.Step 5: Melt the butter in a saute pan and toss the bread crumbs to coat. Top the macaroni with the bread crumbs. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and rest for five minutes before serving.
steps.Step 6: Remember to save leftovers for fried Macaroni and Cheese.

Baked Mashed Potatoes with Parmesan Chee.diffusion_prompt: Photorealistic image of a golden-brown, crispy-topped baked mashed potato dish with parmesan cheese and bread crumbs
Baked Mashed Potatoes with Parmesan Chee.title: Baked Mashed Potatoes with Parmesan Cheese and Bread Crumbs
Baked Mashed Potatoes with Parmesan Chee.description: Transform your Thanksgiving side dish with Giada De Laurentiis' baked mashed potatoes.  These creamy, cheesy potatoes boast a crispy, golden-brown breadcrumb topping, creating a delightful textural contrast. Perfect for a crowd, these potatoes can be prepped ahead of time, making them a stress-free addition to any holiday feast.

ingredients.name: salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a 13 by 9 by 2-inch baking dish with 1 tablespoon of butter and set aside.
steps.Step 2: Cook the potatoes in a large pot of boiling salted water until they are very tender, about 15 minutes. Drain; return the potatoes to the same pot and mash well. Mix in the milk and melted butter. Mix in the mozzarella and 3/4 cup of the Parmesan. Season, to taste, with salt and pepper. Transfer the potatoes to the prepared baking dish. Stir the bread crumbs and remaining 1/4 cup of Parmesan in a small bowl to blend. Sprinkle the bread crumb mixture over the mashed potatoes. Recipe can be prepared up to this point 6 hours ahead of time; cover and chill.
steps.Step 3: Bake, uncovered, until the topping is golden brown, about 20 minutes.

Balsamic-Roasted Brussels Sprouts.diffusion_prompt: Photorealistic image of a plate of balsamic-roasted Brussels sprouts with crispy pancetta, drizzled with balsamic glaze.
Balsamic-Roasted Brussels Sprouts.title: Balsamic-Roasted Brussels Sprouts
Balsamic-Roasted Brussels Sprouts.description: Elevate your weeknight dinners with Ina Garten's Balsamic-Roasted Brussels Sprouts.  Tender, caramelized Brussels sprouts are tossed with crispy pancetta and a flavorful balsamic glaze for a delicious and easy side dish. This recipe is perfect for any occasion, from weeknight meals to special gatherings.  Get ready to impress your guests with this simple yet sophisticated dish.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the Brussels sprouts on a sheet pan, including some of the loose leaves, which get crispy when they're roasted. Add the pancetta, olive oil, 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, and 1/2 teaspoon pepper, toss with your hands, and spread out in a single layer. Roast the Brussels sprouts for 20 to 30 minutes, until they're tender and nicely browned and the pancetta is cooked. Toss once during roasting. Remove from the oven, drizzle immediately with the balsamic vinegar, and toss again. Taste for seasonings, and serve hot.

Best Ever Green Bean Casserole.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a hot, golden-brown green bean casserole, topped with crispy onions, ready to serve.
Best Ever Green Bean Casserole.title: Best Ever Green Bean Casserole
Best Ever Green Bean Casserole.description: Indulge in Alton Brown's irresistible Green Bean Casserole, a Thanksgiving staple reimagined! Crispy, panko-coated onions provide a delightful crunch, elevating this classic dish to new heights.  Tender green beans are bathed in a rich, savory sauce, creating a symphony of flavors that will tantalize your taste buds. This recipe is perfect for a crowd and a guaranteed hit at any holiday gathering.

ingredients.name: 2 tablespoons plus 1 teaspoon kosher salt, divided
1 pound fresh green beans, rinsed, trimmed and halved
12 ounces mushrooms, trimmed and cut into 1/2-inch pieces

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 475 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Combine the onions, flour, panko and salt in a large mixing bowl and toss to combine. Coat a sheet pan with nonstick cooking spray and evenly spread the onions on the pan. Place the pan on the middle rack of the oven and bake until golden brown, approximately 30 minutes. Toss the onions 2 to 3 times during cooking. Once done, remove from the oven and set aside until ready to use. Turn the oven down to 400 degrees F.
steps.Step 3: While the onions are cooking, prepare the beans. Bring a gallon of water and 2 tablespoons of salt to a boil in an 8-quart saucepan. Add the beans and blanch for 5 minutes. Drain in a colander and immediately plunge the beans into a large bowl of ice water to stop the cooking. Drain and set aside.
steps.Step 4: Melt the butter in a 12-inch cast iron skillet set over medium-high heat. Add the mushrooms, 1 teaspoon salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms begin to give up some of their liquid, approximately 4 to 5 minutes. Add the garlic and nutmeg and continue to cook for another 1 to 2 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the mixture and stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute. Add the broth and simmer for 1 minute. Decrease the heat to medium-low and add the half-and-half. Cook until the mixture thickens, stirring occasionally, approximately 6 to 8 minutes.
steps.Step 5: Remove from the heat and stir in 1/4 of the onions and all of the green beans. Top with the remaining onions. Place into the oven and bake until bubbly, approximately 15 minutes. Remove and serve immediately.

Butternut Squash Soup.diffusion_prompt: A vibrant, steaming bowl of creamy butternut squash soup, with a golden hue and a sprinkle of nutmeg
Butternut Squash Soup.title: Butternut Squash Soup
Butternut Squash Soup.description: Indulge in a comforting and flavorful butternut squash soup, perfect for a cozy fall meal.  This easy-to-make soup, with its vibrant colors and rich taste, is a crowd-pleaser.  Perfect as a starter or a hearty main course, you can easily customize it to your liking.  Our pro tips and serving suggestions will help you create the perfect bowl of butternut squash soup, whether you're looking for a classic fall dish or a delicious meal for Thanksgiving or beyond.

ingredients.name: Salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps.Step 1: Cut squash into 1-inch chunks. In large pot melt butter. Add onion and cook until translucent, about 8 minutes. Add squash and stock. Bring to a simmer and cook until squash is tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. Remove squash chunks with slotted spoon and place in a blender and puree. Return blended squash to pot. Stir and season with nutmeg, salt, and pepper. Serve.

Carbonara Mashed Potatoes.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a golden-brown, piping-hot dish of carbonara mashed potatoes, topped with crispy pancetta and swirls of creamy potato mixture.
Carbonara Mashed Potatoes.title: Carbonara Mashed Potatoes
Carbonara Mashed Potatoes.description: Indulge in a decadent dish of creamy mashed Yukon gold potatoes, infused with the savory flavors of crispy pancetta, sharp Parmesan cheese, and rich egg yolks.  This elevated mashed potato casserole is a showstopper, perfect for any celebration.  Imagine piping swirls of the creamy potato mixture into a baking dish, topped with crispy pancetta and a touch of nutmeg, then baking until golden brown.  This rich, comforting dish is sure to impress.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Place the potatoes in a large pot and cover with water by at least 1 inch. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then adjust the heat and continue to boil until the potatoes are easily pierced with a fork, 10 to 12 minutes. Drain the potatoes and let them sit in the colander to dry out a little, about 10 minutes. Place back into the pot.
steps.Step 3: Meanwhile, cook the pancetta in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally, until golden brown and crispy, 7 to 9 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer it to a bowl lined with a paper towel to drain.
steps.Step 4: Add the Parmesan, cream, nutmeg, 14 tablespoons of the butter, 1 tablespoon salt and a generous amount of black pepper to the pot with the potatoes. Mash with a potato masher until well combined and the potatoes are silky smooth. Whisk the eggs and yolks together in a medium bowl then pour into the potatoes and stir until well combined. Fold in all but 1 tablespoon of the pancetta.
steps.Step 5: Spoon 2 cups of the mashed potatoes into the bottom of a 3-quart oval baking dish. Place the remaining potatoes in a large piping bag fitted with a large star tip. Pipe 2-inch-wide dollops on top of the potatoes in the casserole, piping until they are completely covered. Refill the piping bag with any remaining potatoes left in the pot and pipe into the dish. Sprinkle with the remaining 1 tablespoon pancetta.
steps.Step 6: Bake until the potatoes are golden brown on top and around the edges, about 30 minutes. Dice the remaining 2 tablespoons butter into small pieces and scatter over the top of the potatoes. Let the butter melt while the potatoes cool, about 15 minutes.

Classic Turkey Gravy.diffusion_prompt: A rich, golden-brown, photorealistic image of a bowl of creamy, homemade turkey gravy, perfect for Thanksgiving.
Classic Turkey Gravy.title: Classic Turkey Gravy
Classic Turkey Gravy.description: Indulge in a rich and velvety homemade turkey gravy, perfect for completing your Thanksgiving feast. This easy recipe elevates store-bought chicken stock with turkey giblets and vegetables for an incredibly flavorful base.  Finish the gravy while your turkey rests, and prepare for rave reviews as everyone comes back for seconds.

ingredients.name: 1 medium onion or leek, or 2 shallots
Neck and giblets from your turkey
3 sprigs thyme, parsley, rosemary and/or sage
Turkey drippings from your roasting pan
Kosher salt and freshly ground pepper

steps.Step 1: When your turkey goes into the oven, start the broth: Melt the butter in a large saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the onion and turkey neck and giblets; cook, stirring, until the giblets are browned, about 15 minutes. Add the chicken broth, herb sprigs and bay leaf; cover and simmer while the turkey roasts, about 2 hours. Strain the broth and keep warm; reserve the neck and giblets, if desired.
steps.Step 2: When your turkey is done, transfer it to a cutting board and pour all the pan drippings into a degreasing cup. Add 1/2 cup of the prepared broth to the roasting pan and scrape up the browned bits with a wooden spoon. (If the bits are stuck, put the pan over a low burner to loosen them.) Add the bits and liquid to the degreasing cup.
steps.Step 3: Let the fat rise to the top of the degreasing cup, then spoon off 1/2 cup fat and transfer to a large saucepan over medium heat. Make a roux: Sprinkle the flour into the pan and cook, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon, until the flour browns slightly, about 4 minutes.
steps.Step 4: Gradually add the hot broth to the roux, whisking constantly to prevent lumps. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to medium low. Pour the dark roasting juices from the degreasing cup into the gravy, discarding any remaining fat. If desired, chop the giblets and shred the neck meat; add to the gravy. Simmer, whisking occasionally, until the gravy thickens, about 10 minutes. Add the Worcestershire sauce and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the flavored butter, if desired.

Cranberry-Orange Sauce.diffusion_prompt: A vibrant, photorealistic image of a warm, thick cranberry-orange sauce, perfect for Thanksgiving, ready to be served.
Cranberry-Orange Sauce.title: Cranberry-Orange Sauce
Cranberry-Orange Sauce.description: Transform your Thanksgiving table with Tyler Florence's vibrant Cranberry-Orange Sauce. This easy-to-make classic, bursting with fresh orange zest and cinnamon, is a delightful twist on a traditional favorite.  Simmer the cranberries, orange zest, sugar, and cinnamon stick for a flavorful sauce that's perfect served warm or chilled.  Enjoy this delicious sauce as a complement to your holiday meal, or savor it as a delightful standalone treat.

steps.Step 1: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Simmer until cranberries burst and sauce thickens (approximately 15-20 minutes). Serve warm or cool and refrigerate. Remove cinnamon stick before serving.

Perfect Cranberry Sauce.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a bowl of homemade cranberry sauce, glistening and ready to serve.
Perfect Cranberry Sauce.title: Perfect Cranberry Sauce
Perfect Cranberry Sauce.description: This easy-to-make cranberry sauce is a delightful sweet-and-tart Thanksgiving side dish, perfect for any holiday celebration.  Its flavor deepens with time, making it even more delicious the longer it sits.  Enjoy this versatile sauce on turkey sandwiches, pancakes, waffles, oatmeal, or as a basting sauce for chicken and pork.  Leftovers are easily incorporated into other dishes or frozen for later use.

steps.Step 1: Empty a 12-ounce bag of fresh or frozen cranberries into a saucepan and transfer 1/2 cup to a small bowl. Add 1 cup sugar, 1 strip orange or lemon zest and 2 tablespoons water to the pan and cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, until the sugar dissolves and the cranberries are soft, about 10 minutes. Increase the heat to medium and cook until the cranberries burst, about 12 minutes. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the reserved cranberries. Add sugar, salt and pepper to taste and cool to room temperature before serving.

Creamy Garlic Mashed Potatoes.diffusion_prompt: A high-angle, photorealistic image of a creamy, golden-hued bowl of garlic mashed potatoes, garnished with grated Parmesan cheese.
Creamy Garlic Mashed Potatoes.title: Creamy Garlic Mashed Potatoes
Creamy Garlic Mashed Potatoes.description: Indulge in a comforting and flavorful dish with Alton Brown's Creamy Garlic Mashed Potatoes.  This easy-to-make side dish boasts a delightful blend of savory garlic and creamy richness, perfect for any occasion, especially Thanksgiving.  Tender russet potatoes are mashed to perfection, infused with the aroma of garlic and a touch of Parmesan cheese.  The result is a creamy, flavorful side dish that's sure to impress.

steps.Step 1: Peel and dice potatoes, ensuring even sizes. Place in a large saucepan, add salt, and cover with water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce to a rolling boil. Cook until potatoes are easily pierced with a fork.
steps.Step 2: Heat half-and-half and garlic in a medium saucepan over medium heat until simmering. Remove from heat and set aside.
steps.Step 3: Drain the potatoes, mash them, and stir in the garlic-cream mixture and Parmesan cheese. Let stand for 5 minutes to thicken, then serve.

Crispy Baked Boursin with Tangy Cranberr.diffusion_prompt: A platter of crispy, golden-brown baked Boursin cheese rounds, drizzled with tangy cranberry sauce, served with crackers and cruditÃ©s.
Crispy Baked Boursin with Tangy Cranberr.title: Crispy Baked Boursin with Tangy Cranberry Sauce
Crispy Baked Boursin with Tangy Cranberr.description: Indulge in a delightful party appetizer: crispy baked Boursin cheese, boasting a warm, melty interior, perfectly complemented by a tangy cranberry sauce.  Prep both the cheese and sauce a day or two in advance for effortless serving.  Easily scale this recipe for a crowd; arrange rounds on a platter, drizzle with sauce, and serve with crackers and cruditÃ©s for dipping.

ingredients.name: One 5.2-ounce round soft cheese with garlic and fine herbs, such as Boursin

steps.Step 1: For the cheese: Spread some flour for dredging in a shallow bowl. Beat the egg in a second shallow bowl with a splash of water and a pinch of salt. Put the panko in a third shallow bowl, drizzle with the butter and toss well to coat. Add the parsley, chives, thyme and lemon zest and toss with the breadcrumbs. Line a baking sheet with parchment.
steps.Step 2: Dredge the cheese round well in the flour. Coat in the egg, letting the excess drip back into the bowl. Dredge well in the breadcrumb mixture. Coat once more in the egg, then the breadcrumbs, making sure the cheese is well coated. Place on the baking sheet and freeze until solid, at least 2 hours. (It can also be made and frozen a day or two ahead.)
steps.Step 3: For the cranberry sauce: Meanwhile, combine the cranberry sauce, vinegar, coriander, thyme, salt and red pepper flakes. Bring to a simmer and whisk to combine. Simmer over medium until slightly thickened, 2 to 3 minutes. Let cool and transfer to a serving bowl. (The sauce can be made a day or two ahead as well; keep refrigerated until ready to serve.)
steps.Step 4: When ready to serve, position an oven rack in the middle of the oven and preheat to 425 degrees F.
steps.Step 5: Transfer the baking sheet with the cheese to the middle rack and bake until the crumbs are crisp and golden all over, 25 to 30 minutes. Use a wide spatula to transfer to a serving platter. Serve with crackers or cruditÃ© and the tangy cranberry sauce on the side.

Green Bean Casserole.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a classic green bean casserole, featuring crispy panko breadcrumbs, creamy cheese sauce, and tender green beans, ready to be served.
Green Bean Casserole.title: Green Bean Casserole
Green Bean Casserole.description: This decadent Green Bean Casserole, a Thanksgiving staple, features crispy panko breadcrumbs, a rich cheese sauce, and a savory blend of bacon, onions, and bell peppers.  The tender, blanched green beans are perfectly complemented by the creamy sauce, creating a flavorful and satisfying dish that's sure to impress your guests.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Cut the green beans in half if you like the pieces to be a little smaller. Blanch the green beans: drop them into lightly salted boiling water and allow the green beans to cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Remove them from the boiling water with a slotted spoon and immediately plunge into a bowl of ice cold water to stop the cooking process. Drain the beans once they're cool and set aside.
steps.Step 3: Add the bacon pieces to a skillet over medium heat. Cook the bacon for 2 minutes, and then add the peppers, garlic and onions, and continue cooking until the bacon is done (but not crisp) and the onions are golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.
steps.Step 4: In a separate saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat. Sprinkle the flour into the pan and whisk immediately to evenly mix it into the butter. Cook for a minute or 2, and then pour in the milk and half-and-half. Continue cooking, whisking constantly, while the sauce thickens, about 2 minutes. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons salt, some black pepper and the cayenne, and then add the grated cheese. Stir while the cheese melts. Turn off the heat.
steps.Step 5: Add the bacon/onion mixture and stir to combine. Add the green beans and stir gently to combine. Pour into a baking dish and top with the panko. Bake until the sauce is bubbly and the panko is golden, about 30 minutes.

Green Bean Cobbler.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a warm, cheesy green bean cobbler with a flaky biscuit topping, crispy fried onions, and a creamy mushroom sauce.
Green Bean Cobbler.title: Green Bean Cobbler
Green Bean Cobbler.description: Indulge in a comforting twist on green bean casserole! This one-skillet cobbler boasts a creamy mushroom sauce, topped with a flaky, cheesy biscuit topping and crispy fried onions.  Experience the warm, comforting flavors that will make this a new family favorite.

ingredients.name: kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Whisk together the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. Rub the butter into the flour mixture with your fingers until crumbly. Stir in the Cheddar and parsley. Add the half-and-half and stir with a fork or silicone spatula until combined, being careful not to overmix. Refrigerate until ready to use.
steps.Step 3: For the green bean and mushroom filling: Melt the butter in a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the mushrooms and thyme and cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are browned, about 8 minutes. Season with 1/2 teaspoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Sprinkle over the flour and stir until absorbed.
steps.Step 4: Gradually pour in the chicken broth and half-and-half while stirring constantly. Switch to a whisk and whisk to break up any lumps. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Simmer, whisking occasionally, until lightly thickened, about 5 minutes.
steps.Step 5: Remove the thyme stems from the sauce and stir in the green beans, 2 teaspoons salt and 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper until heated through. Taste and add more salt and pepper if needed. Break off walnut-sized pieces of the dough and scatter all over the top of the green bean mixture.
steps.Step 6: Transfer the skillet to the oven and bake until the biscuits are lightly browned on top and fully cooked and the filling is bubbling, 30 to 35 minutes. Sprinkle the fried onions on top and continue baking until the onions are heated through and browned, another 5 minutes.

Herb-Roasted Turkey Breast.diffusion_prompt: A perfectly roasted herb-crusted turkey breast, golden brown and juicy, resting on a platter, with pan juices drizzled over it.
Herb-Roasted Turkey Breast.title: Herb-Roasted Turkey Breast
Herb-Roasted Turkey Breast.description: Elevate your Thanksgiving or any special occasion with Ina Garten's Herb-Roasted Turkey Breast. This flavorful recipe, featuring a symphony of rosemary, sage, and thyme, delivers a juicy and delectable turkey breast.  The simple yet sophisticated herb rub, combined with the delightful wine-infused pan juices, creates a truly unforgettable dining experience.  Perfect for a satisfying main course, this recipe is a must-try for any home cook.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Place the turkey breast, skin side up, on a rack in a roasting pan.
steps.Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the garlic, mustard, herbs, salt, pepper, olive oil, and lemon juice to make a paste. Loosen the skin from the meat gently with your fingers and smear half of the paste directly on the meat. Spread the remaining paste evenly on the skin. Pour the wine into the bottom of the roasting pan.
steps.Step 3: Roast the turkey for 1 3/4 to 2 hours, until the skin is golden brown and an instant-read thermometer registers 165 degrees F when inserted into the thickest and meatiest areas of the breast. (I test in several places.) If the skin is over-browning, cover the breast loosely with aluminum foil. When the turkey is done, cover with foil and allow it to rest at room temperature for 15 minutes. Slice and serve with the pan juices spooned over the turkey.

Homemade Thanksgiving Gravy.diffusion_prompt: A rich, golden-brown homemade Thanksgiving gravy, glistening with a hint of cognac, ready to be served.
Homemade Thanksgiving Gravy.title: Homemade Thanksgiving Gravy
Homemade Thanksgiving Gravy.description: Elevate your Thanksgiving feast with Ina Garten's iconic homemade gravy. This easy recipe, perfect for a crowd, uses leftover turkey drippings and a touch of rich cognac for a depth of flavor.  The lightly browned onions create a delightful base, while the smooth, thickened gravy complements any Thanksgiving meal.  A simple yet impressive addition to your holiday spread!

steps.Step 1: In a large (10 to 12-inch) saute pan, cook the butter and onions over medium-low heat for 12 to 15 minutes, until the onions are lightly browned. Don't rush this step; it makes all the difference when the onions are well-cooked.
steps.Step 2: Sprinkle the flour into the pan, whisk in, then add the salt and pepper. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the hot chicken stock mixture and Cognac, and cook uncovered for 4 to 5 minutes until thickened. Add the wine and cream, if desired. Season, to taste, and serve.

Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a hot spinach and artichoke dip, served in a bowl, garnished with parmesan cheese.
Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip.title: Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip
Hot Spinach and Artichoke Dip.description: Indulge in a crowd-pleasing, hot spinach and artichoke dip, perfect for parties or any gathering. This classic appetizer, enhanced with a touch of heat, is a guaranteed hit.  It's incredibly easy to make, using readily available ingredients and taking only 15 minutes from start to finish.  Simply boil the spinach and artichokes, combine the softened cream cheese with other ingredients, and serve warm for a delicious and satisfying experience.

steps.Step 1: Boil spinach and artichokes in 1 cup of water until tender and drain. Discard liquid. Heat cream cheese in microwave for 1 minute or until hot and soft. Stir in rest of ingredients and serve hot.

Apple Pie.diffusion_prompt: A golden-brown, flaky apple pie with a sweet, spiced filling, ready to be served.
Apple Pie.title: Apple Pie
Apple Pie.description: Indulge in a delectable homemade apple pie, far superior to store-bought options. This recipe provides step-by-step instructions for creating the perfect pie crust, from hand-mixing to using a food processor, and a customizable apple filling.  Experience the satisfying blend of sweet and tart flavors in every bite.  Discover expert tips for a tender, flaky crust and a perfectly balanced apple filling, ensuring a truly unforgettable dessert experience.

ingredients.name: 1 large egg, lightly beaten with 2 tablespoons cold water
3 pounds baking apples like Golden Delicious, Cortland, or Mutsu
2/3 cup sugar, plus more for sprinkling on the pie

steps.Step 1: Make the dough by hand. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, and salt. Using your fingers, work the butter into the dry ingredients until it resembles yellow corn meal mixed with bean sized bits of butter. (If the flour/butter mixture gets warm, refrigerate it for 10 minutes before proceeding.) Add the egg and stir the dough together with a fork or by hand in the bowl. If the dough is dry, sprinkle up to a tablespoon more of cold water over the mixture.
steps.Step 2: Make the dough in a food processor. With the machine fitted with the metal blade, pulse the flour, sugar, and salt until combined. Add the butter and pulse until it resembles yellow corn meal mixed with bean size bits of butter, about 10 times. Add the egg and pulse 1 to 2 times; don't let the dough form into a ball in the machine. (If the dough is very dry add up to a tablespoon more of cold water.) Remove the bowl from the machine, remove the blade, and bring the dough together by hand.
steps.Step 3: Form the dough into a disk, wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until thoroughly chilled, at least 1 hour.
steps.Step 4: Make the filling. Put the lemon juice in a medium bowl. Peel, halve, and core the apples. Cut each half into 4 wedges. Toss the apple with the lemon juice. Add the sugar and toss to combine evenly.
steps.Step 5: In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heat. Add the apples, and cook, stirring, until the sugar dissolves and the mixture begins to simmer, about 2 minutes. Cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until the apples soften and release most of their juices, about 7 minutes.
steps.Step 6: Strain the apples in a colander over a medium bowl to catch all the juice. Shake the colander to get as much liquid as possible. Return the juices to the skillet, and simmer over medium heat until thickened and lightly caramelized, about 10 minutes.
steps.Step 7: In a medium bowl, toss the apples with the reduced juice and spices. Set aside to cool completely. (This filling can be made up to 2 days ahead and refrigerated or frozen for up to 6 months.)
steps.Step 8: Cut the dough in half. On a lightly floured surface, roll each half of dough into a disc about 11 to 12 inches wide. Layer the dough between pieces of parchment or wax paper on a baking sheet, and refrigerate for at least 10 minutes.
steps.Step 9: Place a rack in the lower third of the oven and preheat the oven to 375 degrees F.
steps.Step 10: Line the bottom of a 9-inch pie pan with one of the discs of dough, and trim it so it lays about 1/2 inch beyond the edge of the pan. Put the apple filling in the pan and mound it slightly in the center. Brush the top edges of the dough with the egg. Place the second disc of dough over the top. Fold the top layer of dough under the edge of the bottom layer and press the edges together to form a seal. Flute the edge as desired. Brush the surface of the dough with egg and then sprinkle with sugar. Pierce the top of the dough in several places to allow steam to escape while baking. Refrigerate for at least 15 minutes.
steps.Step 11: Bake the pie on a baking sheet until the crust is golden, about 50 minutes. Cool on a rack before serving. The pie keeps well at room temperature (covered) for 24 hours, or refrigerated for up to 4 days.

Perfect Pie Crust.diffusion_prompt: A perfectly formed, golden-brown, flaky pie crust, ready to be filled with delicious ingredients.
Perfect Pie Crust.title: Perfect Pie Crust
Perfect Pie Crust.description: Effortlessly create a flaky, delicious pie crust with Ina Garten's foolproof recipe.  This easy method, perfect for any pie or tart, uses a food processor for a quick and even dough.  Learn the secrets to a perfect crust, from chilling the ingredients to the precise amount of ice water, ensuring a melt-in-your-mouth experience every time.  Get ready to elevate your pie-making skills with this must-have recipe!

steps.Step 1: Dice the butter and return it to the refrigerator while you prepare the flour mixture. Place the flour, salt, and sugar in the bowl of a food processor fitted with a steel blade and pulse a few times to mix. Add the butter and shortening. Pulse 8 to 12 times, until the butter is the size of peas. With the machine running, pour the ice water down the feed tube and pulse the machine until the dough begins to form a ball. Dump out on a floured board and roll into a ball. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
steps.Step 2: Cut the dough in half. Roll each piece on a well-floured board into a circle, rolling from the center to the edge, turning and flouring the dough to make sure it doesn't stick to the board. Fold the dough in half, place in a pie pan, and unfold to fit the pan. Repeat with the top crust.

Mashed Potatoes.diffusion_prompt: A high-angle, photorealistic image of a bowl of creamy, mashed potatoes, garnished with fresh chives, steaming slightly.
Mashed Potatoes.title: Mashed Potatoes
Mashed Potatoes.description: Experience the ultimate comfort food with Tyler Florence's foolproof mashed potatoes.  This recipe delivers rich, creamy potatoes infused with the subtle herbal notes of bay leaf and chives.  Simply boil the potatoes until tender, then combine with warm cream and butter for a velvety texture.  A touch of chives elevates the dish to a culinary masterpiece, perfect for any occasion, especially Thanksgiving.

steps.Step 1: Put the potatoes into a large pot, add the bay leaf, 2 tablespoons salt, and cover with cold water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes. Drain them well and remove the bay leaf. Meanwhile, heat the cream and butter in a small saucepan. Put the potatoes through a ricer or food mill into a bowl. Add the hot cream and season with salt and pepper. Mix together with a spoon and add the chives.

Juicy Mayo Roasted Turkey.diffusion_prompt: A juicy, roasted turkey, golden brown and glistening, resting on a roasting rack, ready to be carved for a Thanksgiving feast.
Juicy Mayo Roasted Turkey.title: Juicy Mayo Roasted Turkey
Juicy Mayo Roasted Turkey.description: This juicy roasted turkey recipe skips the butter and uses mayonnaise as a flavorful rub, adding moisture and ensuring beautiful browning without constant basting.  The simple marinade infuses the turkey with delicious flavor, resulting in a tender and flavorful bird perfect for any occasion.  Enjoy this easy-to-follow recipe for a moist and flavorful Thanksgiving or holiday feast.

steps.Step 1: Adjust a rack in the lowest position and preheat oven to 325 degrees F.â€¯Set a roasting rack in a large roasting pan.
steps.Step 2: Stir together the mayonnaise, paprika, dried parsley, garlic powder, dried thyme, ground sage, hot sauce, 2 tablespoons salt and 2 teaspoons black pepper in a medium bowl. Set aside.
steps.Step 3: Remove any turkey parts from the neck and breast cavities and reserve for other uses if desired. Dry the bird well with paper towels, inside and out. Rub the mayonnaise mixture all over the turkey, including the cavity, trying to make it as smooth as possible, especially on the breast so it browns evenly. Stuff the cavity with the onion, garlic, herb sprigs and bay leaves.
steps.Step 4: Set the bird breast-side up on the prepared roasting rack. Tent the bird with foil.
steps.Step 5: Roast the turkey for 2 hours. Remove the foil and increase the oven temperature to 425 degrees F. Add a cup of water to the bottom of the pan so that the drippings donâ€™t burn and continue to roast until an instant-read thermometer registers 165 degrees F in the thigh, 30 to 45 minutes. Let the turkey rest about 20 minutes before carving. You can strain the pan drippings and serve them on the side or reserve and blend them into your gravy for extra flavor.

Macaroni and Cheese.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a golden-brown, bubbly, cheesy macaroni and cheese dish, topped with crispy bacon, caramelized onions, and crumbled gorgonzola.
Macaroni and Cheese.title: Macaroni and Cheese
Macaroni and Cheese.description: Indulge in Ree Drummond's irresistible macaroni and cheese, perfect for a comforting meal. This creamy, cheesy delight can be enjoyed immediately as stovetop mac and cheese or made ahead and baked for a classic, bubbly, golden-top experience.  A simple yet satisfying recipe, easily customizable with optional additions like bacon, caramelized onions, and gorgonzola for a truly decadent treat.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Cook the macaroni until still slightly firm. Drain and set aside.
steps.Step 3: In a small bowl, beat the egg. In a large pot, melt the butter and sprinkle in the flour. Whisk together over medium-low heat. Cook for a couple of minutes, whisking constantly. Don't let it burn. Pour in the milk, add the mustard and whisk until smooth. Cook until very thick, about 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low.
steps.Step 4: Take 1/4 cup of the sauce and slowly pour it into the beaten egg, whisking constantly to avoid cooking the eggs. Whisk together until smooth. Pour the egg into the sauce, whisking constantly. Stir until smooth. Add in the cheese and stir to melt. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon seasoned salt and the pepper. Add any additional spices if desired. Taste the sauce and add more salt and seasoned salt as needed! DO NOT UNDERSALT.
steps.Step 5: Pour in the drained, cooked macaroni and stir to combine. Serve immediately (while it's still very creamy) or pour into a buttered baking dish, top with extra cheese and bake until bubbly and golden on top, 20 to 25 minutes.
steps.Step 6: Fry the bacon in a skillet over medium-high heat until slightly crisp, about 8 minutes. Remove from the pan and cut into bite-size pieces.
steps.Step 7: In a separate pan, cook the onions in the butter over a low heat until caramelized, 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
steps.Step 8: Use a fork to crumble the gorgonzola.
steps.Step 9: Put the bacon, caramelized onions and crumbled gorgonzola into separate bowls. Serve as delicious toppings for both sliders and macaroni cheese.

Parker House Rolls.diffusion_prompt: Photorealistic image of golden-brown, freshly baked Parker House rolls, perfect for a Thanksgiving feast.
Parker House Rolls.title: Parker House Rolls
Parker House Rolls.description: Indulge in the irresistible aroma and texture of Parker House rolls, a classic Thanksgiving staple. These buttery, fluffy rolls are perfect for any gathering, impressing your guests with their delicious flavor and satisfying chewiness.  From the initial mixing to the final golden-brown bake, this recipe guides you through each step, ensuring a perfect result every time.  These rolls are a crowd-pleaser, guaranteed to be a hit at your next holiday feast or casual dinner.

steps.Step 1: Place milk in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer. Remove from the heat, stir in the butter and sugar and let cool. Dissolve yeast in warm water and let sit until foamy. Combine milk mixture, eggs, yeast, salt, and 1/2 of the flour in a mixer with the dough attachment and mix until smooth. Add the remaining flour, 1/2 cup at a time, and stir until a smooth ball forms.
steps.Step 2: Remove from the bowl and knead by hand on a floured surface for about 5 minutes. Place in greased bowl, cover, and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 60 to 70 minutes. On a floured surface, punch down the dough and shape into desired shapes. Place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Cover again and let rise until doubled, about 30 to 40 minutes.
steps.Step 3: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 4: Bake for about 20 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and brush with melted butter before serving.

Parmesan Roast Turkey.diffusion_prompt: A perfectly roasted turkey, glistening with golden Parmesan cheese, rests on a wire rack, ready to be carved.
Parmesan Roast Turkey.title: Parmesan Roast Turkey
Parmesan Roast Turkey.description: Indulge in a perfectly roasted turkey, expertly seasoned with a creamy Parmesan-butter mixture under the skin and a crunchy Parmesan topping.  Spatchcocking the turkey, a technique where the backbone is removed and the bird flattened, ensures even cooking.  This results in a juicy, flavorful turkey with a delightful nutty and cheesy taste in every bite.

steps.Step 1: Position an oven rack in the center of the oven and preheat to 375 degrees F. Fit a wire rack inside of a rimmed baking sheet; set aside.
steps.Step 2: Combine the butter, rosemary, thyme, garlic, lemon zest, 1/2 cup of the Parmesan, 1 teaspoon salt and several grinds of pepper in a medium bowl until smooth.
steps.Step 3: Pat the turkey dry, then season all over (both the underside/flesh and skin) with 1 tablespoon salt and several grinds of pepper. Place skin-side up on the prepared baking sheet.
steps.Step 4: Work your fingers between the skin and meat on the breast and top of the turkey legs to loosen, then rub the Parmesan-butter evenly under the skin. Rub the olive oil all over the skin, then sprinkle with the remaining 1 cup Parmesan.
steps.Step 5: Roast until the Parmesan is golden brown and an instant-read thermometer inserted into a thigh reaches 165 degrees F, 1 1/2 to 2 hours. Let rest for 30 minutes before carving.

Pecan Pie.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a warm, golden-brown pecan pie, glistening with a rich, pecan-filled topping, ready to be served.
Pecan Pie.title: Pecan Pie
Pecan Pie.description: Indulge in a decadent pecan pie, a classic Thanksgiving dessert.  This recipe features a flaky, homemade pie crust, paired with a rich and sweet pecan filling.  The perfect combination of textures and flavors will satisfy your sweet tooth.  Follow Ree Drummond's easy steps to create this irresistible treat.

ingredients.name: 3/4 cup salted butter, cut into pieces

steps.Step 1: Mix the flour and salt in a bowl. Add the vegetable shortening and salted butter. Work the butter into the flour using a dough cutter until the mixture resembles tiny pebbles.
steps.Step 2: Add the egg, 5 tablespoons cold water and the white vinegar. Stir until just combined. Divide the dough in half and chill until needed.
steps.Step 3: Mix the granulated sugar, brown sugar, salt, corn syrup, butter, vanilla and eggs together in a bowl.
steps.Step 4: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Roll out one dough half on a lightly floured surface to fit your pie pan. Pour the pecans in the bottom of the unbaked pie shell. Pour the syrup mixture over the top. Cover the top and crust lightly/gently with foil.
steps.Step 5: Bake the pie for 30 minutes. Remove the foil, and then continue baking for 20 minutes, being careful not to burn the crust or pecans. The pie should not be overly jiggly when you remove it from the oven (though it will jiggle a bit). If it shakes a lot, cover with foil and bake for an additional 20 minute or until set. Required baking time seems to vary widely with this recipe. Sometimes it takes 50 minutes, sometimes it takes 75!
steps.Step 6: Allow to cool for several hours or overnight. Serve in thin slivers.

Pecan Squares.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a golden-brown pecan square, cut into pieces, with a rich pecan filling and a buttery shortbread crust.
Pecan Squares.title: Pecan Squares
Pecan Squares.description: Indulge in these irresistible pecan squares, a delightful blend of rich, nutty goodness.  A buttery shortbread crust is perfectly complemented by a decadent pecan topping, creating a symphony of flavors that's sure to satisfy any sweet tooth.  These squares are perfect for holidays, parties, or any occasion where you want to impress with a truly unforgettable treat.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: For the crust, beat the butter and granulated sugar in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with a paddle attachment, until light, approximately 3 minutes. Add the eggs and the vanilla and mix well. Sift together the flour, baking powder, and salt. Mix the dry ingredients into the batter with the mixer on low speed until just combined. Press the dough evenly into an ungreased 18 by 12 by 1-inch baking sheet, making an edge around the outside. It will be very sticky; sprinkle the dough and your hands lightly with flour. Bake for 15 minutes, until the crust is set but not browned. Allow to cool.
steps.Step 3: For the topping, combine the butter, honey, brown sugar, and zests in a large, heavy-bottomed saucepan. Cook over low heat until the butter is melted, using a wooden spoon to stir. Raise the heat and boil for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir in the heavy cream and pecans. Pour over the crust, trying not to get the filling between the crust and the pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes, until the filling is set. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate until cold. Cut into bars and serve.

Perfect Roast Turkey.diffusion_prompt: A perfectly roasted turkey, golden brown and juicy, resting on a wooden cutting board, ready to be carved for a Thanksgiving feast.
Perfect Roast Turkey.title: Perfect Roast Turkey
Perfect Roast Turkey.description: Elevate your Thanksgiving feast or any dinner with Ina Garten's perfect roast turkey.  This recipe, a holiday classic, boasts a juicy, flavorful turkey, achieved with a simple yet effective herbed compound butter.  The combination of lemon, garlic, and thyme infuses the bird with delicious holiday aromas.  Follow Ina's easy steps for a moist and tender turkey, perfect for your holiday table or any special occasion.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Take the giblets out of the turkey and wash the turkey inside and out. Remove any excess fat and leftover pinfeathers and pat the outside dry. Place the turkey in a large roasting pan. Liberally salt and pepper the inside of the turkey cavity. Stuff the cavity with the thyme, lemon, onion, quartered, and the garlic. Brush the outside of the turkey with the butter and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Tie the legs together with string and tuck the wing tips under the body of the turkey.
steps.Step 3: Roast the turkey for 2 1/2 hours, basting from time to time with pan juices, until the juices run clear when you cut between the leg and the thigh. Remove the turkey to a cutting board and cover with foil; let it rest for 20 minutes. Slice the turkey and serve hot.

Pumpkin Gingersnap Cheesecake with Salte.diffusion_prompt: A slice of pumpkin gingersnap cheesecake, topped with salted caramel sauce, whipped cream, and pecans, ready to be enjoyed.
Pumpkin Gingersnap Cheesecake with Salte.title: Pumpkin Gingersnap Cheesecake with Salted Caramel Sauce
Pumpkin Gingersnap Cheesecake with Salte.description: Indulge in a decadent fall dessert! This pumpkin gingersnap cheesecake, boasting a buttery pecan-gingersnap crust and a rich pumpkin filling, is elevated by a luscious salted caramel sauce.  The perfect blend of warm spices and sweet caramel will leave you craving more.  Enjoy this irresistible treat, perfect for special occasions like Thanksgiving or Christmas.

steps.Step 1: In a food processor or blender, grind the gingersnaps until fine. Combine with pecans, melted butter, brown sugar, and salt. Press mixture into a 10-inch springform pan and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
steps.Step 2: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 3: Beat softened cream cheese until smooth. Mix in pumpkin puree. Add eggs one at a time, then sour cream. Gradually add sugar, cinnamon, vanilla, and nutmeg. Mix until combined.
steps.Step 4: Pour filling into the chilled crust. Bake until the filling is almost set but still slightly jiggly (about 50 minutes). Turn off the oven, leave the cheesecake inside for 15 minutes with the oven door slightly ajar. Let cool for 30 minutes, then refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight.
steps.Step 5: In a saucepan, combine brown sugar, heavy cream, butter, vanilla, and salt. Cook over medium-low heat, whisking constantly, until thickened (5-7 minutes). Let cool and refrigerate until needed.
steps.Step 6: Slice cheesecake and top with salted caramel sauce, whipped cream, and chopped pecans.

Roasted Butternut Squash Salad with Warm.diffusion_prompt: A vibrant roasted butternut squash salad with warm cider vinaigrette, featuring arugula, walnuts, and parmesan cheese, ready to be served.
Roasted Butternut Squash Salad with Warm.title: Roasted Butternut Squash Salad with Warm Cider Vinaigrette
Roasted Butternut Squash Salad with Warm.description: This vibrant roasted butternut squash salad, tossed in a warm, tangy cider vinaigrette, is a delightful fall dish.  Tender roasted squash is perfectly complemented by crisp arugula and crunchy walnuts, creating a symphony of textures and flavors. The vinaigrette's sweet and tangy notes elevate the salad to a new level of deliciousness, making it a perfect side dish for any occasion.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Place the butternut squash on a sheet pan. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil, the maple syrup, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper and toss. Roast the squash for 15 to 20 minutes, turning once, until tender. Add the cranberries to the pan for the last 5 minutes.
steps.Step 3: While the squash is roasting, combine the apple cider, vinegar, and shallots in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook for 6 to 8 minutes, until the cider is reduced to about 1/4 cup. Off the heat, whisk in the mustard, 1/2 cup olive oil, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon of pepper.
steps.Step 4: Place the arugula in a large salad bowl and add the roasted squash mixture, the walnuts, and the grated Parmesan. Spoon just enough vinaigrette over the salad to moisten and toss well. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Roasted Sweet Potatoes with Honey and Ci.diffusion_prompt: Photorealistic image of a dish of roasted sweet potatoes with honey and cinnamon, golden brown and caramelized, ready to be served.
Roasted Sweet Potatoes with Honey and Ci.title: Roasted Sweet Potatoes with Honey and Cinnamon
Roasted Sweet Potatoes with Honey and Ci.description: Indulge in Tyler Florence's crave-worthy roasted sweet potatoes, boasting a perfect balance of sweet and savory flavors.  These caramelized, crispy sweet potatoes, with their tender, fluffy insides, are a guaranteed crowd-pleaser.  This easy recipe reveals the secret to achieving even cooking and intense caramelization, guiding you through the perfect roasting time and temperature.  Perfect as a Thanksgiving side dish or a delightful weeknight meal, these sweet potatoes are sure to be a star of any gathering.

steps.Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Lay the sweet potatoes out in a single layer on a roasting tray. Drizzle the oil, honey, cinnamon, salt and pepper over the potatoes. Roast for 25 to 30 minutes in oven or until tender.
steps.Step 3: Take sweet potatoes out of the oven and transfer them to a serving platter. Drizzle with more extra-virgin olive oil.

Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms.diffusion_prompt: Photorealistic image of a baking dish filled with golden-brown, sausage-stuffed mushrooms, ready to be served.
Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms.title: Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms
Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms.description: Elevate your next gathering with Ina Garten's irresistible Sausage-Stuffed Mushrooms. This elegant appetizer, bursting with flavor, features sweet Italian sausage, perfectly complemented by a medley of savory ingredients.  Prepare a delightful symphony of textures and tastes with these easy-to-make, crowd-pleasing mushrooms.

ingredients.name: salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Remove the stems from the mushrooms and chop them finely. Set aside. Place the mushroom caps in a shallow bowl and toss with 3 tablespoons of the olive oil and Marsala. Set aside.
steps.Step 3: Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add the sausage, crumbling it with the back of a wooden spoon. Cook the sausage for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring frequently, until it's completely browned. Add the chopped mushroom stems and cook for 3 more minutes. Stir in the scallions and garlic and cook for another 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the panko crumbs, stirring to combine evenly with all the other ingredients. Finally, swirl in the mascarpone and continue cooking until the mascarpone has melted and made the sausage mixture creamy. Off the heat, stir in the Parmesan, parsley, and season with salt and pepper, to taste, Cool slightly.
steps.Step 4: Fill each mushroom generously with the sausage mixture. Arrange the mushrooms in a baking dish large enough to hold all the mushrooms in a snug single layer. Bake until the stuffing for 50 minutes, until the stuffing is browned and crusty.

Sausage and Herb Stuffing.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a golden-brown, hot, and flavorful sausage and herb stuffing dish, perfect for Thanksgiving, ready to be served.
Sausage and Herb Stuffing.title: Sausage and Herb Stuffing
Sausage and Herb Stuffing.description: This flavorful stuffing, perfect for Thanksgiving or any holiday meal, combines savory Italian sausage with sweet apples and dried cranberries.  The combination of textures and tastes will delight your guests.  A simple yet satisfying side dish, this recipe is easy to prepare and adapt to your liking.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Place the bread cubes in a single layer on a sheet pan and bake for 7 minutes. Raise the oven temperature to 350 degrees F. Remove the bread cubes to a very large bowl.
steps.Step 3: Meanwhile, in a large saute pan, melt the butter and add the onions, celery, apples, parsley, salt and pepper. Saute over medium heat for 10 minutes, until the vegetables are softened. Add to the bread cubes.
steps.Step 4: In the same saute pan, cook the sausage over medium heat for about 10 minutes, until browned and cooked through, breaking up the sausage with a fork while cooking. Add to the bread cubes and vegetables.
steps.Step 5: Add the chicken stock and cranberries to the mixture, mix well, and pour into a 9 by 12-inch baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes, until browned on top and hot in the middle. Serve warm.

Sausage Cornbread Stuffing.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a golden-brown, rustic cornbread stuffing, studded with cranberries and walnuts, ready to be served at a Thanksgiving dinner.
Sausage Cornbread Stuffing.title: Sausage Cornbread Stuffing
Sausage Cornbread Stuffing.description: This Thanksgiving staple is a showstopper!  A flavorful blend of savory sausage, aromatic herbs, and crunchy walnuts, all nestled within moist cornbread cubes and finished with a touch of sweetness from dried cranberries.  This easy-to-make stuffing is perfect for a crowd and will impress your guests.

ingredients.name: 1 pound spicy sausage, casing removed, broken into bite-size chunks
3 cloves garlic, smashed and finely diced
10 cups stale cornbread, cut into 1-inch cubes

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Coat a large saute pan with olive oil, add the onions and celery and saute over to medium heat. Season with salt and cook until the vegetables start to become soft and are very aromatic. Add the sausage and cook until the sausage begins to brown. Stir in the garlic and saute for another 1 to 2 minutes. Add the walnuts, sage and rosemary and cook for another minute, then remove from heat.
steps.Step 3: In a large bowl mix together the cornbread, cranberries, and the sausage mixture. Add chicken stock and knead with your hands until the bread is very moist, actually wet. Taste to check for seasoning and season with salt, if needed and transfer to an ovenproof dish.
steps.Step 4: Bake the stuffing until it is hot all the way through and is crusty on top, about 30 to 35 minutes.

Scalloped Potato Gratin.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a golden-brown, bubbling scalloped potato gratin, topped with melted Parmesan cheese and fresh thyme
Scalloped Potato Gratin.title: Scalloped Potato Gratin
Scalloped Potato Gratin.description: Elevate your next meal with Tyler Florence's decadent Scalloped Potato Gratin!  This creamy, comforting side dish is perfect for holidays or any special occasion.  Layers of tender, perfectly cooked potatoes, infused with aromatic herbs and a rich, savory cream sauce, topped with a sprinkle of Parmesan, create a symphony of flavors.  This easy-to-follow recipe is sure to impress your guests and become a new family favorite.

ingredients.name: salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: In a saucepan, heat up the cream with the bay leaves, thyme, garlic, nutmeg and some salt and pepper.
steps.Step 3: While the cream is heating up, butter a casserole dish. Use a slotted spoon to remove the bay leaves and thyme. Pour the heated cream into a large bowl with the potato slices. Mix gently to coat the potatoes. Dust the Parmesan over the potatoes. Season the mix with a little bit of salt and pepper. Mix to gently incorporate. Spoon a little bit of the cream into the bottom of the casserole dish. Then spoon the potatoes in. Level out the potatoes for uniform cooking time. Pour the remaining cream at the bottom of the bowl over the top. Top with some Parmesan and fresh thyme leaves. Cover the dish with aluminum foil, but pull back one corner for the steam to escape. Bake for 40 minutes.

Sheet Pan Crispy Mashed Potatoes.diffusion_prompt: A high-angle, photorealistic image of crispy, golden-brown sheet pan mashed potatoes, sprinkled with fresh chives, ready to be served.
Sheet Pan Crispy Mashed Potatoes.title: Sheet Pan Crispy Mashed Potatoes
Sheet Pan Crispy Mashed Potatoes.description: Transform your Thanksgiving or holiday celebrations with these unbelievably crispy mashed potatoes!  A test kitchen mishap led to the perfect combination of crispy golden-brown bits and creamy interiors.  Boiled and then tossed in hot oil, these potatoes are baked to golden perfection, seasoned with chives, and ready to impress.  Enjoy this easy-to-make side dish that's sure to be a crowd-pleaser.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Fit a wire rack in a sheet pan.
steps.Step 2: Add the potatoes to a large pot and cover with cold water by at least 1 inch. Heavily salt the water and bring to a boil over high heat. Continue to boil until the potatoes can be easily smashed with the back of a spoon, about 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes in a colander, then shake the colander as hard as you can without losing any of the potatoes until they are roughed up and craggy. Transfer the potatoes to the prepared sheet pan and let dry for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, pour the vegetable oil onto a separate sheet pan and heat in the oven for 10 minutes.
steps.Step 3: Carefully remove the sheet pan from the oven and transfer the potatoes to the hot oil (carefully, as the oil might splatter a bit). Gently mash the potatoes with the back of a spoon until they fill most of the sheet pan, then season with 1 tablespoon salt and a few grinds of pepper. Scatter the butter over top of the potatoes.
steps.Step 4: Bake until the bottoms of the potatoes are turning golden brown, about 45 minutes. Toss the potatoes and continue to bake until the bottoms are golden brown and the tops are golden brown in a few places, another 50 to 55 minutes.
steps.Step 5: Let cool slightly, about 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and sprinkle with the chives.

Creamy Mashed Potatoes.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a creamy, golden-brown, hot, mashed potato casserole, perfect for Thanksgiving.
Creamy Mashed Potatoes.title: Creamy Mashed Potatoes
Creamy Mashed Potatoes.description: Indulge in a comforting and creamy mashed potato casserole, perfect for any occasion, especially Thanksgiving.  This easy recipe boasts a rich, buttery flavor, thanks to a blend of potatoes, softened butter, cream cheese, half-and-half, and cream.  A simple yet satisfying dish that's sure to impress your guests.

ingredients.name: salt and freshly ground black pepper

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Peel the potatoes and rinse them in cold water. Chop the potatoes in fourths. Place the potatoes into a large pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until fork tender, 20 to 25 minutes.
steps.Step 3: Drain the potatoes, and then return them to the pan. With the burner on low heat, mash the potatoes with a potato masher; the more steam that's released while you mash, the better. Mash for about 5 minutes. Turn off the burner.
steps.Step 4: Add the butter, cream cheese, half-and-half, and seasonings. Stir to combine, and if the mixture needs thinning, add milk. Check the seasonings, adding salt and pepper, to taste.
steps.Step 5: Pour the mashed potatoes into a large casserole pan. Dot the surface with butter. Cover with foil and bake in the oven for 15 minutes. Remove the foil and continue baking for 10 more minutes. Serve immediately.

Sweet Potato Souffle.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a golden-brown sweet potato souffle, topped with a crunchy pecan crumble, ready to be served.
Sweet Potato Souffle.title: Sweet Potato Souffle
Sweet Potato Souffle.description: Elevate your Thanksgiving feast with Trisha Yearwood's irresistible Sweet Potato Souffle! This delightful dish, a symphony of sweet potatoes, a touch of vanilla, and a crunchy pecan topping, is sure to be a crowd-pleaser.  Experience the perfect balance of creamy, sweet, and savory flavors in this easy-to-make, show-stopping recipe.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 2 1/2-quart baking dish with butter.
steps.Step 2: Poke the sweet potatoes with a fork and bake on a foil-covered baking sheet until they are soft, 1 hour. When cool enough to handle, peel the potatoes, place the flesh in a large mixing bowl and mash until very smooth. Add the eggs, sugar, butter, vanilla, milk and salt. Combine well with an electric mixer or hand mixer. Turn the mixture into the baking dish.
steps.Step 3: In a medium bowl, stir together the pecans, brown sugar, flour and butter until thoroughly combined. Spoon the mixture over the sweet potatoes, making an even layer. Bake the casserole until slightly browned, 40 minutes. Let the casserole sit for 5 minutes before serving.

Thanksgiving Cornucopia Cookies.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of Thanksgiving cornucopia cookies, frosted and decorated with corn snacks, chocolate chips, and sprinkles, showcasing the festive cornucopia design.
Thanksgiving Cornucopia Cookies.title: Thanksgiving Cornucopia Cookies
Thanksgiving Cornucopia Cookies.description: These festive sugar cookies are perfect for Thanksgiving, easier than pie, and fun to decorate.  The no-chill dough is easily scooped and shaped, resulting in tender, subtly sweet cookies.  Decorate them with horn-shaped corn snacks, chocolate chips, and sprinkles for a delightful cornucopia effect.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment or silicone mats.
steps.Step 2: Whisk the flour, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl until evenly combined; set aside. Beat the butter, sugar and nutmeg in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium-high speed until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add the whole egg plus yolk and vanilla extract; mix until completely incorporated. Reduce the speed to low and mix in the dry ingredients until just combined.
steps.Step 3: Using a 1 1/2-tablespoon cookie scoop, drop level scoops of dough about 2 inches apart on the prepared baking sheets (about 12 cookies per sheet). Gently roll each scoop of dough into a ball and flatten it into a round about 1/3 inch thick. Bake the cookies one sheet at a time until lightly golden brown on the bottom, 10 to 11 minutes. Transfer the cookies to a wire rack and let cool completely. Let the oven to come back up to temperature before baking the second sheet of cookies.
steps.Step 4: For the frosting: Meanwhile, combine the confectioners' sugar, butter, vanilla and salt in a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or in a large bowl if using a handheld mixer). Beat on low speed to mix the ingredients together, then increase the speed to medium high and beat until light, fluffy and smooth, about 3 minutes. Mix in as much milk as needed if the frosting is too stiff to spread easily.
steps.Step 5: Spread about 2 teaspoons of frosting on top of each cookie. Top each with a corn snack off-center, with the pointy end facing out; add the chips and sprinkles so they appear to be spilling out of the cornucopia.
steps.Step 6: Any leftover cookies can be stored in an airtight container at room temperature.

Thanksgiving Stuffing Focaccia.diffusion_prompt: A golden-brown, rustic Thanksgiving stuffing focaccia, topped with crispy sausage and fresh herbs, ready to be served.
Thanksgiving Stuffing Focaccia.title: Thanksgiving Stuffing Focaccia
Thanksgiving Stuffing Focaccia.description: Transform your Thanksgiving with this irresistible stuffing focaccia.  A delightful blend of moist, custardy vegetables and a crispy crust, topped with savory sausage and fresh herbs, this bread is sure to be a crowd-pleaser.  Enjoy this unique twist on a classic Thanksgiving side dish.

steps.Step 1: Melt butter in a skillet, add celery and onion, cook until softened. Stir in sage, bouillon, and pepper, cook until dissolved and water evaporates. Transfer to a plate and cool.
steps.Step 2: Whisk flour, yeast, and sugar in a stand mixer. Add warm water and 2 tablespoons olive oil, mix until moistened. Let stand 5 minutes.
steps.Step 3: Add salt, knead on medium speed for 5 minutes. Add cooled vegetables and parsley on low speed.
steps.Step 4: Oil a large bowl, transfer dough, flip to coat with oil. Cover and let rise until doubled, about 2 hours.
steps.Step 5: Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a pan, add sausage, cook until crisp. Transfer to a plate and cool.
steps.Step 6: Pour remaining olive oil into a baking sheet. Spread dough evenly, top with sausage. Make dimples on the surface.
steps.Step 7: Dissolve 1 teaspoon salt in 1/4 cup warm water, drizzle over focaccia. Cover and let rise for 45 minutes.
steps.Step 8: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F.
steps.Step 9: Uncover focaccia, sprinkle with flaky salt. Bake until golden brown, rotate halfway through. Drizzle with olive oil, let sit 5 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Thanksgiving Turkey Brine.diffusion_prompt: A perfectly roasted Thanksgiving turkey, glistening with rich butter, ready to be carved and served.
Thanksgiving Turkey Brine.title: Thanksgiving Turkey Brine
Thanksgiving Turkey Brine.description: Elevate your Thanksgiving feast with this incredibly moist and flavorful turkey brine recipe.  This easy-to-follow method ensures a perfectly cooked bird, bursting with deliciousness.  A simple yet powerful brine, infused with a blend of savory ingredients like molasses, honey, and soy sauce, will transform your turkey into a culinary masterpiece.  The recipe also includes a step to add richness and moisture to the turkey's breast meat, resulting in a Thanksgiving feast that everyone will adore.

steps.Step 1: In a medium pot, bring 3 quarts of the tap water to a boil over medium heat. Put the kosher salt in a large bowl and slowly (and carefully!) pour the boiling water over the salt. Stir to blend.
steps.Step 2: Add the molasses, honey, soy sauce, red pepper flakes, sage, thyme and garlic to the salt and water mixture. Stir to blend. Add the remaining 3 quarts of cool water. Add the ice to a cooler or bucket large enough to hold the brine and the turkey. Pour the brine over the ice and use a large whisk to blend all of the ingredients.
steps.Step 3: Submerge the turkey, breast side down, in the brine. Make sure the cavity of the bird fills with the liquid as you are submerging it. Cover the cooler and allow the bird to sit in the brine overnight or for about 12 hours.
steps.Step 4: Remove the bird from the brine and dry it thoroughly with thick (absorbent) kitchen towels. Take care to wipe inside the cavity as well. Discard the brine. Whisk together the butter and the lemon zest. Gently lift the skin covering 1 breast of the turkey and spread half of the butter right on the meat under the skin. Repeat with the other breast. The butter will add extra moisture and richness as the bird roasts.
steps.Step 5: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F.
steps.Step 6: Arrange the turkey in a roasting pan fitted with a rack. Put on the lower rack of the oven and roast until the internal temperature of the turkey taken from the thickest part of the thigh reads 170 degrees F on an instant-read thermometer, about 3 1/2 hours. Remove the turkey from the oven to a cutting board or serving platter and tent with foil. Allow to rest for 15 minutes before carving and serving.

The Best Sweet Potato Casserole.diffusion_prompt: A photorealistic image of a warm, golden-brown sweet potato casserole with a crunchy pecan crumble topping.
The Best Sweet Potato Casserole.title: The Best Sweet Potato Casserole
The Best Sweet Potato Casserole.description: This sweet potato casserole boasts a delightful crunch from a nutty pecan crumble topping, perfectly contrasting the creamy, soft mashed sweet potatoes.  The filling is infused with a deep caramel flavor from brown sugar and vanilla, enhanced by the richness of butter and eggs. This recipe is a guaranteed holiday favorite, or a delicious treat any time of year.  It's easy to make ahead, allowing you to prepare the filling a day in advance and store it separately from the topping.  Reheat easily for a warm or cold serving.

ingredients.name: unsalted butter, melted, plus more for buttering the baking dish

steps.Step 1: Boil sweet potatoes until tender, then mash.
steps.Step 2: Preheat oven to 350Â°F and butter a 2-quart baking dish.
steps.Step 3: Whisk together filling ingredients (butter, mashed sweet potatoes, milk, brown sugar, vanilla, salt, and eggs) and pour into the baking dish.
steps.Step 4: Combine topping ingredients (flour, brown sugar, butter, salt, and pecans) until clumped. Sprinkle evenly over the filling.
steps.Step 5: Bake until set and golden, 25-30 minutes.

Traditional Roast Turkey.diffusion_prompt: A perfectly roasted, golden-brown traditional Thanksgiving turkey, ready to be carved and served.
Traditional Roast Turkey.title: Traditional Roast Turkey
Traditional Roast Turkey.description: This recipe takes a traditional roast turkey to the next level with a flavorful brine that infuses the bird with deliciousness.  The step-by-step instructions, from thawing and brining to roasting and resting, ensure a perfectly cooked, juicy turkey with crispy skin.  Enjoy this Thanksgiving classic, expertly crafted by Alton Brown.

steps.Step 1: Two to three days before roasting: Begin thawing the turkey in the refrigerator or in a cooler kept at 38 degrees F.
steps.Step 2: Combine the broth, salt, sugar, peppercorns, allspice and ginger in a large stockpot and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Stir until the salt and sugar dissolve. Remove from the heat. Cool to room temperature and refrigerate the brine.
steps.Step 3: The night before you'd like to eat: Truss the legs of the turkey with kitchen twine if desired. Combine the brine, water and ice in a 5-gallon bucket. Place the thawed turkey, with innards removed, breast-side down in the brine. If necessary, weigh down the bird to ensure it is fully immersed, cover and refrigerate or place everything in a cooler. Turn the bird once halfway through brining.
steps.Step 4: Day of roasting: Heat the oven to 500 degrees F. Remove the bird from the brine and rinse inside and out with cold water. Discard the brine.
steps.Step 5: Place the bird on a roasting rack inside a half sheet pan and pat dry with paper towels. Rub the bird with canola oil. Roast the bird on the lowest rack of the oven for 30 minutes.
steps.Step 6: While the bird is cooking, fold and shape a double thickness of aluminum foil into a closely fitting breastplate.
steps.Step 7: After 30 minutes, decrease the oven temperature to 350 degrees F, insert a probe thermometer into the thickest part of the breast and cook until the temperature reaches 155 degrees F. Use the breastplate at any point during cooking should the bird become too brown.
steps.Step 8: Rest the bird, covered lightly with aluminum foil, for 15 to 30 minutes. Carve and serve.

World's Simplest Thanksgiving Turkey.diffusion_prompt: A perfectly roasted Thanksgiving turkey, glistening with butter, resting on a platter, surrounded by fresh herbs and vegetables.
World's Simplest Thanksgiving Turkey.title: World's Simplest Thanksgiving Turkey
World's Simplest Thanksgiving Turkey.description: Effortlessly prepare a perfect Thanksgiving turkey with this foolproof recipe from Food Network Magazine.  This easy method involves seasoning the turkey, stuffing it with aromatics like onions, carrots, apples, and herbs, and roasting it in stages.  The result is a juicy, flavorful turkey with crispy skin, ready to impress your guests.  No need for a complicated brine or fryer; this recipe delivers a delicious Thanksgiving centerpiece.

steps.Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Remove the turkey's neck and giblets (discard the liver). Pat the turkey dry with paper towels, then season inside and out with salt and pepper. Fill the turkey cavity with aromatics (chopped onions, carrots, apples, and herbs). Place the turkey breast-side up in a roasting pan and brush with melted butter. Cover with foil and roast for 2 hours (adjust cooking time for larger turkeys by adding 15 minutes per pound).
steps.Step 2: Remove the foil, baste the turkey with more melted butter, and increase the oven temperature to 425 degrees F. Roast for another hour, or until the internal temperature of the thigh reaches 165 degrees F. Let the turkey rest, covered, for at least 20 minutes before carving.
